name: Hotel Elysee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I expected a luxury hotel and not a step back in time. While the hotel may have been a jewel some years ago, at not time do I expect to encounter dust (on top of the armoire and on the headboard). Lighting was dim everywhere, the elevator was slow in arriving every time and the bathtub had all the height of a wine bottle. The hairdryer had tubing attached to it that looked like central vacuuming and I wondered if they had Ernestine on the switchboard somewhere. The continental breakfast was nice enough but for the price, I was very disappointed in the hotel.
reviews.title: Elysee A Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd asked for a room on a high floor to avoid street noise and was not given one although I booked more than a month in advance. The noise was noticeable immediately. I asked to be moved and was put on a lower floor facing the 'courtyard' which is a large grouping of fan coil units which was noisier than the traffic had been. My planned four night stay turned into a one night stay and a search for something nicer. I found it at The Millenium Broadway which exceeded expectations.
reviews.title: Elysee = Perfection

likes.liked: — The outstanding service , location, and clean, comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New York City is the epicenter for so many of the world's finest things: food, fashion, business and finance, etc. So it always stuns me when I see chain restaurants and hotels packed with tourists when so many unbelieveable options exist to truly have that quintessential "New York Experience."
reviews.title: Fabulous find in Manhattan

likes.liked: — The quality of hotel and staff, and the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I came here for a week long vacation and to visit family. We chose the Elysee for its close proxmity to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. It came through in every way imaginable. The rooms were clean, elegant, and comfortable. The staff was incredibly accomodating and offered world class service. When you stay at the Elysee, you really feel like a guest in a someone's home instead of some drone in some 40 story monolith with a fanny pack and an I heart NY t-shirt on. John the general manager personally went out of his way to make sure we had the best vacation possible. It was that small attention to detail that truly made our vacation as relaxing and memorable as it could be.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

likes.disliked: — curtains didn't close all the way in our room, but no big deal!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: PROS: Close to subway, world class restaurants, shopping, Central Park, excellent service without being overbearing, clean and comfortable rooms, free breakfast, free happy hour with wine and snacks, SERVICE, SERVICE, SERVICE
reviews.title: Great location & a bargain by NYC sandards

likes.liked: — Room size; location; amenities (breakfast & evening wine reception included in room rate)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel - quiet, friendly, convenient and extremely comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. As exciting as the city is, it was nice to be able to seek peace and quiet at the end of the day. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I love this hotel and will never stay anywhere else in New York, if I can help it. It is everything you need - central, clean, convenient. Free internet. The beds are so comfortable, the toiletries are really luxurious. The rooms are lovely and spacious. The sitting room on the second floor is comfortable and with complimentary lemonade, tea, coffee, it is everything you want. All the staff members I met were helpful and courteous. Just a fantastic place. Right across the street from a Robert Indiana LOVE sculpture and a characterful ex-speakeasy, Bill's 90s bar. Near to good restaurants and some reasonably priced places to eat. 5th Ave, Central Park, Madison Ave, MOMA all within 5 -10 minutes walk. We walked to Times Sq. Very central and convenient. Off-site gym was fantastic, apparently (my husband said). Our party had 2 rooms one of which had a balcony, which was amazing. The rooms were beautiful, as you can see from the photo.
reviews.title: Superbe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: not only was the staff friendly and knowledgeable they went out of their way to make my wife and I welcome on our honeymoon. A fantastic experience. The hotel is located near many world class restaurants and shopping making for an easy and stress-free visit. Additionally, the massage booked through the hotel was one of the best my wife has ever had.
reviews.title: our best experience in NY City - Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Perfect room, perfect location. Very nice and helpfull staff.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've travelled a lot around the world and thought we'd found some wonderful hotels. However, we've just discovered a gem that ranks among the best - the Hotel Elysee in New York. The location on East 54th St between Madison and Park Avenues, is perfect. Despite being in midtown Manhattan, the rooms are quiet, and beautifully appointed, relaxing and comfortable. The club lounge for complimentary continental breakfast is a delight and the selection of food items is excellent. In the early evenings, the lounge is a lovely place to relax over complimentary wine and assorted cheeses and canapes after a busy day. The wine selection is very good and the staff are generous.
reviews.title: A World Class Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great hotel! Large rooms for NY. Good A/C. Quiet. Marble bath, hallway and wet bar. Spotless. Maids did not disturb when sign was on the door. I didn't eat breakfast but hubby said it was great. Great location. Fine linens, good amenites, firm comfy bed. I liked it better than the Casablanca, the Michelangelo, the Algonquin (tiny rooms), the Lucerne and all the others I've stayed at with the exception of the St. Regis which is twice the price and maybe the Lowell (also twice the price) Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: New favorite hotel in NY
A hidden gem in the center of Manhattan
reviews.text: We love small European hotels and rarely see anything similar in the United States. We could have sworn we were in Paris but we were in the middle of New York. The hotel oozes charm, the breakfast is incredible, the stafff very friendly and helpful and the price is right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel elysee.. what a fabulous hotel!! the hotel is gorgoeus, the rooms are charming .. the marble bathroom just right.. i thought i was back in paris!!
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: the hotel staff was uniformly pleasant and helpfull ...always had a cheerful attitude.. i travel alone and am a "more mature " lady so really appreciate this!! and what a treat to have breakfast and "wine and cheese" in such a deligtful atmosphere!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to sum up, this is the only hotel in new york for me now!! i just hesitate to tell everyone about this gem.. i'd rather keep it a secret!!!!!!
reviews.title: Loved the bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were enchanted by the Hotel Elysee during our two night midweek stay. We chose the hotel solely because of its proximity to the Museum of Modern Art. Little did we know we would fall in love with nearly everything about the place.
reviews.title: Enchanting Elysee

likes.liked: — Intimate atmosphere, friendly and low-key staff, second floor library w/breakfast & happy hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you've ever stayed in a small hotel in Paris offseason, you know how it feels to have all the benefits and privacy of a hotel stay with the warmth and hospitality of a visit with good friends (who also happen to have a lovely home).
reviews.title: Elysee is great option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The moment our taxi driver dropped us off a couple of hundred feet short of our hotel, the Elysee bellman rushed over to welcome us and take our luggage off our hands. When we walked into the lobby, four fresh smiling faces greeted us from behind the reception desk. These young men and women couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, and I swear they never go home or sleep!
reviews.title: European feel, good Manhattan value
Excellent Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: Our room was on the seventh floor and faced the street. It was small but impeccably decorated and laid out. There was a wee bit of street noise but nothing unusual or jarring. We had a gracious sitting area where we enjoyed a bottle of champagne, a desk (with free Wifi) overlooking the great architecture of E. 54th St., a handsome marble bathroom with a terrific shower, a very, very comfortable bed, and tons of closet and drawer space.

reviews.title: Fabulous in every way
reviews.text: After long days of sightseeing, dining and shopping, we enjoyed coming "home" to "sit a spell" in the second floor library and dining area. There's nothing like some coffee, cookies, and a few minutes of quiet time on a comfy couch to reinvigorate you before a big night out on the streets of NY. The daily breakfast and happy hour were simple, but gracious, touches that added to our comfort and relaxation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was so excited having read some wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor but... it was just okay. I liked the quaintness though, and our room was lovely. But, our bathroom was not clean - hair in the sink and tub upon arrival - and quite small. I never thought I would care if my room had a peephole or not but the door buzzers on the rooms to either side of us were so loud, I thought there was someone at my door several times and had to open the door to find out.
reviews.title: Not That Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. Great location but I think not a great value.
reviews.title: An OK Value for the Price

likes.disliked: — Bathroom was too small with no place to put anything, old furniture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Elysee for three nights in November over a long weekend. I would agree with another review that says that the hotel is not a great value for the money.
reviews.title: Great small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are some of the high and low points:
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
My favorite hotel in all of NYC!!!
reviews.text: High Points:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Elysee for three nights and it was wonderful. The room was large for New York, very clean & quiet, (a plus in midtown NY!) Staff was very helpful & the continental breakfast & evening wine & snacks was an added plus!!
reviews.title: Loved our stay!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Elysee is well located in Mid-town. The room was lovely and very comfortable. We especially liked the breakfast and cocktails on the 2nd floor. The staff was courteous and professional and our every request was met. I left an item in the room and it was sent to me the next day. We will definitely return to Hotel Elysee.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

likes.liked: — Small size of hotel and locations

reviews.title: Loved the Elysee!
reviews.text: The room was HUGE. The staff anticipated our requests. The bell man arranged tentative airport transport without our asking. We had only to approve his choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since our flight didn't leave until 8 pm, the use of the club room and a place to change our clothes transformed the last day of our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Loved the Elysee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had moved over from the Waldorf (having wanted to try it once in our lives)--no comparison. How can they get away with charging 50% above the Elysee?
reviews.title: Will never return to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.title: Hotel Elysee was Fabulous!
charming hotel...average staff
reviews.text: Reviewer: TripAdvisor member from San Antonio, TX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Family of three (son age 14) stayed in a suite for 4 nights. Suite was huge by New York standards. Very nicely decorated, great king bed and large marble bathroom (which had separate shower and tub). Room was on 10th floor facing street--some street noise (particularly early in morning), but not too bad. Second floor clubroom and the complimentary continental breakfast were outstanding! And service was perfect. Second floor library has complimentary computer with internet access. Staff overall was great--very friendly and helpful. No full time concierge, but front desk staff was knowledgable. Location is super--on 57th Street between Madison and Park. It's only a block and a half from great 5th Ave shopping and very close to Central Park and Rockefeller Center. Also easy walking distance to Broadway shows and Times Square. Did not try Monkey Bar restaurant, as they had recently changed the menu and are no longer a steak house. Hotel Elysee is a wonderful boutique hotel in a perfect location; I recommend it without hesitation!
reviews.title: Outstanding Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a quaint, charming boutique hotel that has a European feel to it. As others have noted, there is a room where you can get coffee/tea all day as well as a nice breakfast in the morning. There is also a computer available for internet use. The rooms are decent sized (for NY) and quite comfortable. Rooms are clean...decorated nicely. Much nicer than a generic hotel chain. The only downside is the staff. Most of them seem somewhat immature, lacking the sophistication you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. They do the bare minimun, but do not exhude professionalism. Overall, this is a great hotel and I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Typical European Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Second time visit to NYC and the Elysee Hotel. Location, location, location...The Elysee is close to everything and its staff is "second to none". The hotel 's atmosphere is inviting and its staff was very helpfull from directions to making reservations in the best venues of NYC. I will continue to stay here on my next visits to NYC and will reccommend the Elysee to all interested individuals. Great time!!
reviews.title: A wonderful boutique hotel in Manhattan

likes.liked: — Great location, good breakfast buffet, stylish rooms, efficient and nice staff
likes.disliked: — The A/C in the room shuts off during the day so it can be stuffy when you return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in a regular suite.
reviews.title: Desperately in need of some TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: wonderful! Everything I could ask for in a Hotel!
Best Hotel and Location in New York!
reviews.text: Our room was extremely quiet. The air conditioning worked great and was also quiet. The bellhops and doormen were very nice. We hardly ever saw any other guests or heard a peep from another room. Although, there is only one elevator, it was never an issue. We never had to wait longer than 2 minutes for it to arrive. The front staff when we arrived was wonderful. He let us check in extremely early. That was the best part of our stay. The hotel is really quaint. I love older buildings (Hotel Del on Coronado is one of my favorite). It was neat to stay in a place with history. The free breakfast was a nice touch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad:
reviews.title: A charming hotel in a perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The carpet in our room was very dirty and old. It should have been replaced years ago. The bathroom was outdated and ugly. Although our room was quiet, this was because it had a "lovely" view of the brick building next door. Beds were okay. Not very comfortable, but we were so exhausted from walking in the heat all day, we were able to sleep fine. We spent a fortune on taxis because this hotel is not convenient to a lot of the things that we wanted to see (3 plays in Time Square, Statue of Liberty, Natural History Museum, Chinatown). It is also a fair walking distance to the subway. In the summer heat it felt extremely far. We have stayed 3 times at the Westin in Times Square and the convenience of that location cannot be beat.
reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel in excellent midtown location
Very impressed
reviews.text: A very enjoyable place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We make a trip to NYC once a year and we've stayed at a handful of hotels in recent years. None of them stands out in my memory except the Elysee.
reviews.title: Elysee's A Deal

likes.disliked: — If was anything, the one elevator - which cannot be changed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's calm and quiet, the staff is friendly and courteous, the decor is nicely done in a subdued-elegance sort of way. Our room was large by NYC standards, comfortable and quiet (we were on the 12th floor).
reviews.title: Great hotel - would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a complimentary continental breakfast in the morning and a complimentary wine-and-cheese buffet in the evening. The checkout time is a very civilized 1 PM.
reviews.title: A Piece of Tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: No one thing makes the Elysee stand out, but there are a lot of little things that, taken altogether, add up to a very enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Centrally located, quiet hotel with indifferent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: A friend recommended Hotel Elysée and we considered the price to be a bit high. Than we considered location and what we would save on cabs. When arrived we found freshly cut fruit for breakfast. The bagels were fresh with a good variety. After walking back to the hotel after working all day we always had lemonade and cookies in the sitting room. The staff were very helpful and always available. These small touches made all the difference.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Elysee to celebrate our anniversary. The staff was incredible, giving us a lovely room with a terrace to enjoy. The manager also sent up a bottle of prosecco and truffles. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat (and as a native NYer, I thought it was a great combination of exceptional service and location). We'll be back in the city this summer and hope to stay once more at the Elysee.
reviews.title: Incredible stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was only an overnight, but I know we will back to the Hotel Elysee!
reviews.title: We will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We drove to the city & parked with the hotel valet with ease. We waited in the hospitality area & enjoyed tea & cookies as we waited for our room (short wait as we arrived prior to check-in). After our dinner & show we returned to The Monkey Bar for a drink.
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel in a perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: In the morning, after a restful sleep in our very quiet room, we enjoyed a beautiful continental breakfast (coffee, fruit, croissants, & anything else you can think of). Then, we were on our way. We have never stayed at the same hotel twice when traveling to NYC because there are so many wonderful choice. But, we will be back to the Hotel Elysee
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay, Great Location, Fantastic Staff- Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: It was so hot in NYC that when I opened the car door, it felt like I was standing in front of a blast furnace, so when the cool air of this hotel's lobby wrapped its comforting arms around me, I just started to smile. This hotel is great, because it combines the old world elegance I expect to find in NYC, with the extra values that other upscale hotels just soak you for. Here parking for 24 hrs is $25.00 not $45.00, wireless internet is free not $10.00 per day, a wonderful continental breakfast which includes: fresh fruit, bagels and baked goods, cereal, hard boiled eggs, coffee, fresh juice, and tea. The bathrooms are marble, the room furnishings elegant topped off with a crystal chandlier. The elevator is a tad slow, but hey nothing is perfect, nor should it be. I had only one problem which was that drain in the shower didn't work well, it was fixed promptly. The chamber maids to the front desk staff were all considerate, and helpful. The location is wonderful, two blocks from 5th Ave, several incredible restaurants, 2 blocks from the "6" train, and 3 blocks from the new MOMA. A hotel is simply a building, but it is people with the right management who make it work, and this hotel has got the right stuff.
reviews.title: Old world elegance without killing your pocket book

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We just returned from a three night stay at the Elysee. IT COULD NOT HAVE BEEN BETTER. There were nine ladies and every single one of us felt that we made the right choice. Meeting in the morning in their second flour lounge was terrific. We could set an approximate time to meet and would then be able to enjoy the best continental breakfest we have ever had. FRESH was the word of the day. Could it get any better. Yes. The wine and cheese hours were spectacular. After walking all day, and before the theater, we just loved meeting there. We also loved the location. If I had to make one comment, it would be that the carpet in our suite should be replaced. However, carpet or not, this is where my husband and I are staying on our next trip there.
reviews.title: Unbelievable
Great location!
reviews.text: Location excellent - a quick walk from Saks! Breakfast featured whole grain rolls that we Scandos like and freshly squeezed orange juice, which made up for the dismal filter coffee in thermos jugs. Lovely room, bigger than expected, but it was unusually hot and humid outside, and the air-conditioner even at the highest setting was weak. Single slow elevator and a full hotel meant waiting a bit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent a week at the Hotel Elysee and found the ambiance charming and the staff very friendly. Upon our arrival we were welcomed as if we just arrive home by the hotel’s doorman and front desk staff. We had arrived before check-in and the staff held our bags while we explored the sites and sounds of New York.
reviews.title: Oasis in the Desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the lobby we were surprised by a beautiful centerpiece of flowers which illuminated the room. Unlike many hotel rooms in New York City, our room was spacious and the furniture in excellent condition. Additionally, I enjoyed using the free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Not for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were skeptical of the complementary breakfast that the hotel offers, but found it to be a nice touch, as they offer a assortment of goodies, including coffee, tea, a wide variety of pastries, and fresh fruit salad, along with a number of periodicals for your reading pleasure.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Lovely Place to Stay in NYC
What a disappointment!
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located and within easy walking distance of Central Park and plenty of shopping. On multiple occasions, we contacted the hotel concierge for restaurant recommendations and they made excellent choices and reservations without prompting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Elysee is now my favorite place to stay in NYC. We have never stayed the same place twice because there has always been something we didn't like about our last hotel, whether it was the location, the price or the service. Not so with Elysee, This little jewel is perfect. The rooms are just right, with cozy, comfortable beds, bathrooms plenty big and spotless. There is always a snack of cookies and tea available and they have a teatime treat of cheese and wine in the late afternoon. I am a very finicky eater and quite often that was my main meal. The service was wonderful and I just loved the doorman, Tony. You couldn't find a nicer place. It is just off Madison Ave and a very easy walk to Central Park.
reviews.title: A Hidden Jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a lovely hotel! Hotel Elysee was very well located to everywhere we wanted to go, including the MoMA and Broadway. The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated, and the breakfast was perfect each morning. Most importantly the staff were excellent! They helped us organize our trip and book all of our restaurants. So friendly and so knowledgeable!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel Elysee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent midtown (almost upper east) location --- theaters, Central Park, shopping, museums all walkable. Fairly quiet side street; upper floor rooms facing the back are very sedate. Decent breakfast served in upper floor lounge: think older English seaside hotel of a generation ago. Library off the lounge/dining room has a computer with free internet access. Rooms are typically New York smallish but not microscopic; bathrooms spartan and small. Minibar with sensors. Not a luxury hotel and probably could do with some gentle renovation. Very good service. Not many rooms...many foreign guests attracted, perhaps, to value and location and understatement.
reviews.title: Older, clean, well-located, quirky, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It was my second stay at the Elysee Hotel and not my last.
reviews.title: Excellent location, Very good hotel and service,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is just perfect and the hotel has a friendly atmosphere and service making you feeling confortable. Very good value for money.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the hotel because of all of the good reviews on Tripadvisor. It is true that the location is excellent and that the staff is quite nice. And, there is a certain quaintness staying in a 99 room hotel in NY. But, for $425 per night for a basic room, the value is not there. Let me explain.
reviews.title: Not a good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: No disrespect to our European friends who review on this site, but American expectations for a proper hotel room are quite different: The room must be quiet, the bed superb, and the room spacious.
reviews.title: Friendly Personal Atmosphere

likes.liked: — plenty of space and storage modern but not overdesigned bathroom sitting room with tea coffee etc
likes.disliked: — one could walk to many things but the subway a little far away.

reviews.title: enjoy our stay
reviews.text: First, why not a coffee maker in the room? The continental breakfast is free in the library, so it's not as if they are trying to force you to pay for the product. It is so darn inconvenient to have to get dressed, go down to the library and fill up a cup and hoof it back to your room with cup in hand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Whatever happened to a free morning paper at your door? Is 50 cents too much for the hotel to spend for a NY times? Or am I one of the last dinosaurs that likes to read a paper in the morning?
reviews.title: Nice hotel...

likes.liked: — location, clean room, wine and cheese from 5-8

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because the hotel is old, you will have to listen to the air conditioning unit under the window starting up and shutting down all night long (just like at a Motel 6). (Up to date hotels have units that are vented into the rooms overhead and the compressors are located elsewhere.)
reviews.title: Very nice, but would try elsewhere next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Elysee for 7 nights in June. The stay as wonderful, with excellent care shown by the hotel staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

likes.disliked: — lighting was a bit too dim for my liking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was provided daily at the lounge. I shouldn't be complaining, but I guess about the only issue I have with this was the lack of variation when it came to the breakfast buffet menu.
reviews.title: Excellent but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Otherwise, as I have said, my wife and I was given perfect service, and we would certainly stay there again if we do visit NY.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a wonderful property in a good location in Manhattan. The staff were very accommodating, and our suite was very comfortable. There were two things that kept me from rating this as excellent. First, the club room, which is where continental breakfast and afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres are served, both complimentary, is understaffed. As a result, tables are not bussed in a timely manner, and it was often difficult to find a place to sit at breakfast. Second, the hotel does not have a fitness facility on premises. They have an arrangement with a health club several blocks away, and although that might not be uncommon in Manhattan, I still think that is a negative. Otherwise, our stay there was very enjoyable.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I brought my daughter to NYC this past weekend for her 10th birthday and we stayed at the Hotel Elysee, as our family always does when we come to NYC. We have stayed at a variety of Manhattan hotels over the years, but once we had been to Hotel Elysee a few years ago, we never have stayed anywhere else, whether it is my husband and I travelling together or one or both of us with one or both of our daughters (now 10 and 13). The hotel is lovely, the staff courteous and helpful --- and the location couldn't be more convenient.
reviews.title: Rare Find
Pleasant surprise!
reviews.text: The Elysee' came highly recommended and did not disappoint. We returned in September for 3 more nights and have become fans. The Club room is pleasant and the breakfast and wine and cheese spread were plentiful. We will certainly return and recommend it to friends. Location can't be beat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Hotel exceeded our expectations both in service and ambiance. We also felt it's location was a plus. Everyone from cleaning help to front desk were extremely helpful.We would definitely recommend the Elysee and would stay again. The only minor area is our mini-suite should signs of getting tired. I am sure the excellent staff wil attend to this minor issue.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: See you on our next trip to New York.
reviews.title: Hotel Elysee is a gem!

likes.liked: — The hotel looked better in person than it did in photographs.
likes.disliked: — When turned on, the air conditioning unit was loud.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Elysee. The staff was very welcoming and helpful with various transportation issues that developed due to a taxi strike. The Elysee has converted me from a regular at the larger hotels in NYC to the smaller, more charming hotels like this one. We look forward to returning soon, and will stay at this hotel or one of its sister properties (Giraffe and The Library).
reviews.title: Outstanding concierge

description: At the Hotel Elysée, you will find the warmth and charm of a countryside inn right here in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. Like some of the most distinctive bed and breakfasts in the world, the Hotel Elysée offers its guests so much more than is ever expected from a luxury hotel – all included in the nightly rate. At Hotel Elysee, guests are welcome to unwind in the clubroom with complimentary refreshments serviced throughout the day, including the Library Hotel Collection’s signature Continental Breakfast Buffet each morning, wine and cheese receptions each evening from 5PM-8PM, and coffee, tea, cookies and fresh fruits are served all day. Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the hotel and bottled water is provided daily.
